page.title: 01Hills Around Loch Torridon
page.content: The hills around Loch torridon are ragged, rocky and heather clad. The main feature of this area is Ben Damph, the peak Sgurr na Bana Mhoraine rises to 687 metes. The land is estate land used for grazing sheep and deer. The gamekeeper in charge of the deer and fishing rights on Loch Damph lives in Balagy House at the mouth of the Balgy River. A local fisherman has a small mussel farm in Ob Gorm Beag. The coastline is rocky and covered with mainly deciduous woods. The only road in the area is the A896 which connects the villages of shiedaig ad Torridon.
